column4: Hi everyone. I am installing Ubuntu on a Pentium 4 (128 MB RAM). I have noticed that the minimal requirements for graphic installations is 256 MB RAM, so, mi question is:
If I get mre RAM ans install it, when I remove the excedent RAM will I have any problem running ubuntu?
I think the install needs more memory since it runs as a live cd too.

I think you'll be fine even if you remove the extra memory after the install.. even better would be to use the alternate cd to install.. it has a lighter text based install that doesn't need as much memory
